1.text: Mix the yeast and the warm water together in a small bowl.

2.text: Mix yeast mixture, milk, sugar, salt, eggs, shortening, and 2 cups of the flour in a mixer on a low speed.

3.text: Beat in remaining flour, ½ cup at a time, at a low speed.

4.text: Knead the dough with your hands and knuckles for 5 minutes until the dough is smooth but elastic.

5.text: Set the dough into a greased bowl to rise.

6.text: On a floured surface, roll the dough out until it's about 0.5 inch (1.3 cm) thick.

7.text: Let the doughnuts rise again until double their size (about 30-60 minutes).

8.text: Prepare the glaze while doughnuts are rising.

9.text: Heat the oil in a deep fryer or skillet until oil reaches a temperature of 350℉ (175℃).

10.text: Slide the donuts into the oil carefully, with metal tongs or a spatula.

11.text: Remove doughnuts from oil and let drain on a wire rack.

12.text: While doughnuts are still warm, dip doughnuts into the glaze, coating evenly.

14.text: Into a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, nutmeg, cinnamon and salt.

15.text: Stir milk, eggs, vanilla, and shortening together before incorporating into dry mix.

16.text: Fill the doughnut pan so each cup is ¾ full.

17.text: Bake the doughnuts for 8-10 minutes, until they are springy when touched.

19.text: In a large bowl, mix yeast, warm water, and pinch of sugar until foam begins to show (about 5 minutes).

20.text: Into the yeast mixture, stir in milk, ⅓ cup sugar, salt, vanilla extract, eggs, and ⅓ cup vegetable oil.

21.text: Mix in about 2½ cups of the whole-wheat flour.

22.text: Form the dough into one big ball, place into a greased bowl, and cover.

23.text: Place the dough back on a well-floured surface and knead again to reshape it.

24.text: Shape the heaping tablespoon of dough into a thin strip or an oval shape.

25.text: Place rolled bits of dough under a cloth to rise while you shape the remainder of the dough.

26.text: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 375℉ (190℃).

27.text: While oil is heating, combine 2 cups of sugar with cinnamon and set aside for dusting.

28.text: Gently introduce pastries into the frying oil, one at a time, cooking for 1-2 minutes per side, until golden brown.

29.text: Remove excess oil from fried pastries with paper towels.
